body:
As a user of Spack I want to generate "merged" module files so that I can have a single module file for multiple configurations of a package with a behavior that changes according to the loaded environment.

### Rationale

Spack currently maps each single concrete spec to a corresponding module file. Many sites though are used to module files that map to multiple specs and whose behavior is controlled by:

- The environment variables that are set
- Prerequisites modules that have been loaded already

The idea of this issue is to implement a way to generate "merged" module files that satisfy the use cases above.

### Description

The implementation is still to be defined. It would be probably better to collect a certain amount of use cases to drive design decisions.

### Additional information

#2345 is already implementing something that goes into this direction.
title: Merge multiple specs into a single tcl module file
